greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into distinct positive parts <= n, with parts combined by IOR (inclusive or).
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
D. Applegate, M. LeBrun, N. J. A. Sloane, Dismal Arithmetic, J. Int. Seq. 14 (2011) # 11.9.8.
mathematica: A003465[n_] := Sum[(-1)^k*Binomial[n, k]*2^(2^(n - k)), {k, 0, n}]/2; a[n_] := A003465[DigitCount[n, 2, 1]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 53}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 21 2012, from formula *)
xref: Cf. A003465 (if duplicates are removed from the current sequence), A000120, A054243 (XOR version).
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_, Feb 08 2000
